description: Discover the world's longest natural sea beach at Cox's Bazar with your guide, Aisha Rahman. Miles of golden sands, vibrant local markets, and the soothing sound of the waves make it a perfect destination for relaxation and water activities.
tips: Catch a sunrise or sunset at the beach

description: Immerse yourself in the lush green tea gardens of Srimangal with your guide, Rahim Khan. Known as the 'Tea Capital of Bangladesh,' this serene town offers tea estate tours, wildlife sanctuaries, and a chance to savor the finest local teas.
tips: Visit during the tea harvesting season

description: Embark on an adventure in the Sundarbans, the largest mangrove forest in the world, with your guide, Sara Ahmed. Cruise through its intricate waterways, spot the elusive Bengal tiger, and witness the unique biodiversity of this UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Explore the picturesque landscapes of Bandarban, nestled in the Chittagong Hill Tracts, with your guide, Khaled Khan. From lush green hills to indigenous communities, this region offers a blend of natural beauty and cultural richness.

Sylhet beckons with its rolling tea gardens, serene lakes, and spiritual sites, guided by Fatima Islam. Explore the tea estates, visit the Ratargul Swamp Forest, and witness the vibrant culture of this northeastern city.
highlights: Hazrat Shah Jalal University of Science and Technology
tips: Visit the Shah Jalal University campus

description: Discover the dynamic capital city of Bangladesh, Dhaka, with your guide, Imran Ali. From historical landmarks to bustling markets, Dhaka offers a vibrant blend of the old and the new, providing a glimpse into the country's rich history and modern development.
